Schedule your heating system appointment today by calling A+ Derr at [site_info_phone_number] or contacting us online!

Signs You Need HVAC Service

It can help homeowners to know when their HVAC system isn’t working correctly. Here are some common signs that it’s time to call for trustworthy HVAC services. Common signs include:

  • Strange noises If your HVAC system is making weird sounds like rattling, grinding, or squealing, it could mean that there is a worn or loose part that needs to be replaced or adjusted.

  • Unusual odors If your HVAC system is giving off strange smells, there could be a buildup of dirt, dirt, or mold in the system or ducts.

  • Inadequate heating or cooling If your HVAC system isn't heating or cooling properly, you may have a clogged air filter, blocked ductwork, or a malfunctioning component.

  • High energy bills Climbing energy bills are a sign your HVAC system isn't running efficiently.

  • Short-cycling: Short-cycling is when your system frequently turns on and off. This can happen from a malfunctioning thermostat, a clogged air filter, or a problem with the system's compressor or fan.

For expert HVAC services in Henderson, count on A+ Derr. Call us at [site_info_phone_number] or contact us online for a free estimate today!

Indoor Air Quality in Henderson

Make the air in your Henderson home as clean as possible with indoor air quality services from A+ Derr. With proper tools and techniques, like duct cleaning, we can help you reduce the dust, allergens, bacteria, and other irritants in your ductwork.

Other benefits of duct cleaning include:

  • Improved HVAC efficiency: Clean air ducts offer fewer blocks for your HVAC system, making it easier to heat and cool your home. This can lead to lower energy bills and improved comfort.

  • Reduced fire risk: The buildup of dust and debris in your air ducts can increase the fire risk. Regular duct cleaning can help reduce the risk of a fire hazard.

  • Longer HVAC life span: Clean ducts can help extend the life of your HVAC system and help keep it running efficiently for longer.

Get clean indoor air with A+ Derr. Contact us today at [site_info_phone_number] or schedule online today!

Why Choose A+ Derr?

At A+ Derr, we understand how much you care about your Henderson home. That’s why we ensure our technicians are certified and ready to deliver exceptional customer service. We stand behind our work with a 100% satisfaction guarantee.

We’ll work with you to find the best HVAC solutions for your needs and budget. Plus, we offer our Maintenance Plan for added convenience and cost savings.

When you choose A+ Derr, you choose the local experts committed to providing you peace of mind. Let us help you keep your home comfortable and safe all year round.

Count on A+ Derr for your HVAC services in Henderson. Call us at [site_info_phone_number] or contact us online today!

Frequently Asked Questions

[bc_accordion] [bc_card title="When should I have my HVAC system serviced?"] You should have your heating system serviced before the cooling season and your cooling system before the heating system. If you have a system that both heats and cools, like a heat pump, it is recommended that you get professional service between the heating and cooling seasons. [/bc_card] [bc_card title="Is good indoor air quality important to your home?"] In short, indoor air quality is far more polluted than outdoor quality. These pollutants include allergens, dirt, mold, and much more. These contaminants affect your family’s health and, sometimes, sleep. Installing an air cleaner, purifier, or scrubber can improve your home's air quality. [/bc_card] [bc_card title="How often should I change my system’s air filters?"] Air filters should be replaced at least every 90 days. However, you should replace your filters more often if:
  • You have more than two pets that shed fur
  • Someone in your home has respiratory issues
  • Your home is in an area that has more allergens
[/bc_card] [/bc_accordion]

item.title: Geothermal Systems in Louisville, Evansville & Kentuckiana
item.dc:creator: bluecorona_seo
item.content:encoded:
A+ Derr Heating and Cooling is a fourth-generation family-operated company that proudly serves residents of Louisville, Kentucky; Evansville, Indiana; and the surrounding areas. We offer extensive heating and cooling services, including geothermal heat pump repairs, replacements, and preventative maintenance.

For service you can trust, call A+ Derr Heating & Cooling at [site_info_phone_number] or contact us online.

What Is a Geothermal System?

A geothermal system uses the Earth’s thermal energy to keep your home cool in the summer and warm in the winter. This works because the ground temperature stays relatively consistent throughout the year. Geothermal systems use ground loops, piping filled with fluid installed horizontally or vertically in the ground. Depending on the season and your needs, the loop allows heat to be transferred in or out of your home.

[cta_shortcode]

Geothermal Systems Services

The A+ Derr team is qualified and trained to service geothermal systems throughout Louisville, Evansville, and the surrounding Kentuckiana areas. We offer geothermal installations and replacements, repairs, and routine maintenance.

Installation & Replacement

While it’s important to have professionals install any HVAC system, this is especially true with a geothermal system. The team at A+ Derr is experienced and qualified to install geothermal systems so that they work correctly and safely for years to come.

Repair

Although geothermal heat pumps are durable and efficient, they occasionally encounter problems, especially as they age. This is especially true if a professional doesn’t maintain them yearly. If your system isn’t keeping up with the heat in the summer or the cold in the winter, our team can help.

Maintenance

The best way to keep your geothermal system working properly for year-round comfort is to schedule a routine inspection and tune-up twice a year: once before the cooling season and once before the heating season. This allows us to catch minor issues before they become big problems and ensure your system runs efficiently for the season ahead.

[cta_button]

To schedule reliable geothermal services in Louisville, KY, or Evansville, IN, call A+ Derr at [site_info_phone_number] or contact us online today.

Benefits of Installing a Geothermal System

There are many benefits to geothermal systems for Louisville and Evansville residents, including those listed below:

  • Energy-efficient: Compared to other HVAC systems, geothermal heat pumps are the most energy-efficient options.

  • Better value: With significantly lower operating costs and a longer life span than other HVAC systems, geothermal systems quickly pay for themselves.

  • Peace and quiet: With no need for an outside unit, these systems are incredibly quiet.

  • Low maintenance: This simple system has fewer parts to break down and maintain.

Schedule your geothermal installation today by calling [site_info_phone_number], or contact us online to get started.

Choose A+ Derr for Geothermal Services

For all your heating and cooling needs in Evansville and Louisville, trust the professionals at A+ Derr. When you choose our team, you can expect the following:

  • 24/7 service
  • 100% satisfaction guarantee
  • Free estimates on replacement quotes & service calls
  • Lennox Premier Dealer

For heating and cooling services you can trust, call [site_info_phone_number], or contact us online.

FAQs

[bc_accordion] [bc_card title="Can a geothermal system be installed in existing homes?"] Although it’s easiest to install a geothermal system during new construction, installing it with an existing home is possible. Our team can assess your property and determine which modifications would be necessary for a successful installation. [/bc_card] [bc_card title="What is the life expectancy of a geothermal system?"] You can expect your geothermal system to last 20 to 25 years with proper maintenance. [/bc_card] [/bc_accordion]

Our team can help determine if a geothermal system is right for you. Get started by calling [site_info_phone_number] or contacting us online today.

When your home needs comprehensive boiler services, contact the experts at A+ Derr. With service in Louisville, Evansville, and the surrounding areas, we’re proud to offer boiler installation, replacement, repair, and maintenance with a 100% satisfaction guarantee. At A+ Derr, we believe in giving our customers the highest quality products and services. For all your boiler service needs, turn to A+ Derr — your call for comfort! Contact us today at [site_info_phone_number] or request service online.

Boiler Services

A boiler system uses hot water instead of forced air to keep your home warm and is one of the most energy-efficient heating options. Thanks to the thermal conductivity of water, a boiler will heat your home evenly and reliably, giving you great comfort all season long.

[cta_shortcode]

Boiler Installation & Replacement

If your boiler is nearing the end of its life span or is starting to require frequent and costly repairs, it may be time for an upgrade. At A+ Derr, our experts are here to walk you through replacing your current boiler system, from selecting the right unit that meets your needs to providing superior installation services.

Don’t wait until your boiler fails and leaves you stuck without heat in the winter cold. Instead, consider upgrading today and experience these great benefits:

  • Greater energy efficiency
  • Improved heating power
  • Lower operating costs
  • Reduce risks of breakdown
  • Increase your home’s value

Schedule installation or replacement services in Kentuckiana today by calling [site_info_phone_number] or contacting us online.

24/7 Boiler Repair

When your boiler is no longer operating at peak performance, trust the experts at A+ Derr to provide exceptional repair services. Our technicians have the knowledge and skills to quickly diagnose your boiler’s issue and complete the necessary repairs to get your heat back on in no time. If you’re experiencing any of the following, you may need repair:

  • Minimal heat: If you can’t get your house warm enough, regardless of the temperature on your thermostat, your boiler may have an issue that inhibits its ability to deliver heat throughout your home.
  • Unusual sounds or smells: Whistling or thumping signs indicate that your boiler has damage, whereas foul odors could mean a gas leak and serious danger.
  • Leaks: If you notice leaks from your boiler, this could be a sign of damage and may lead to increased energy usage or the risk of your boiler bursting.
  • Power cycling: If your boiler is frequently turning on and off, there is a good chance of an issue with the boiler’s power supply.

Call the A+ Derr team at [site_info_phone_number] or contact us online today for a free estimate.

Boiler Maintenance Services

The average life span of a boiler is about 15 years. We recommend routine boiler maintenance to extend that life span and reduce the risk of breakdowns or costly repairs. Like every other element of your home comfort system, your boiler can benefit significantly from regular tune-ups. Our technicians will thoroughly inspect your system to ensure there are no issues and fix any minor problems before they become more serious.

Schedule boiler maintenance services in Kentuckiana today by contacting us online or calling [site_info_phone_number].

Why Choose A+ Derr?

Trust A+ Derr with your Kentuckiana home’s boiler needs! Since 1975, we’ve been proud to provide Louisville and Evansville with the highest quality home comfort services. We offer free estimates on replacement quotes, and with 24/7 service, you can rest assured that your comfort is always our priority

For superior boiler service in Kentuckiana, call the experts at A+ Derr today at [site_info_phone_number] or contact us online.

Frequently Asked Questions

[bc_accordion] [bc_card title="Does a boiler heat hot water for my home too?"] It can! There are many boiler options, including “combi” boilers that heat your home and your water and other systems that use an external water tank. [/bc_card] [bc_card title="How often should I have my boiler serviced?"] Having your boiler serviced at least once a year is recommended. It is typically a good idea to schedule this before the cold season to ensure that you will have safe and reliable heat throughout the winter. [/bc_card] [/bc_accordion]

[cta_button]

item.title: Dehumidifier Service in Evansville, IN & Louisville, KY
item.dc:creator: bluecorona_seo
item.content:encoded:
A+ Derr Heating & Cooling is a family business that has served the Evansville and Louisville community for over half a century with A-plus home service, including in-home dehumidifiers. As one of this area's largest technician fleets, we guarantee customer satisfaction with quality products and services delivered promptly and professionally.

Humidity can impact the comfort and health of your Evansville home. Call [site_info_phone_number] to schedule dehumidifier installation.

Benefits of Installing a Dehumidifier

High humidity levels can make a home feel uncomfortable and promote mold growth, which can harm your health. Installing a dehumidifier can provide many benefits that can improve your quality of life. Here are some of the key advantages of installing a dehumidifier in your home:

  • Reduces Humidity Levels: Dehumidifiers remove excess moisture from the air, helping reduce humidity levels in your home. This can make the air feel more comfortable and reduce the likelihood of mold growth.
  • Prevents Mold and Mildew: Dehumidifiers can help prevent mold and mildew from growing in your home by reducing humidity levels. It’s essential in areas of your home prone to moisture, such as the basement or bathroom.
  • Reduces Allergies: Dehumidifiers can help reduce allergies by removing mold, dust mites, and mildew from the air. This can be especially beneficial for people who suffer from allergies or asthma.
  • Improves Air Quality: By removing excess moisture and allergens from the air, dehumidifiers can improve the overall quality of the air in your home.
[cta_shortcode]

Expert Dehumidifier Installation

At A+ Derr Heating & Cooling, we believe having clean and comfortable air in your home is crucial to your health and well-being. That's why we offer top-notch dehumidifier installations that can help improve indoor air quality and make your home more pleasant. Our experienced technicians will work with you to find the right dehumidifier for your home and ensure it's installed correctly and efficiently.

Don’t know what kind of dehumidifier fits your Evansville home? You’re in luck. Our knowledgeable team can help you find the right indoor air quality solution when you call [site_info_phone_number].

Why Choose A+ Derr?

At A+ Derr, we are proud to be the trusted provider of dehumidifier services for homeowners in Evansville and Louisville. We understand the importance of indoor air quality and offer free estimates on replacement quotes and service calls to ensure our clients clearly understand the costs involved.

Our team is passionate about providing reliable support when you need it most and use the latest technology and equipment to diagnose and solve dehumidifier problems efficiently and effectively.

Our team is committed to your overall comfort. Let us help you protect your at-home health with professional dehumidifier services. Call 833) 232-4328 or contact us online to schedule service today.

Dehumidifier FAQs

[bc_accordion][bc_card title="Do dehumidifiers help with mold?"]

Yes, dehumidifiers help with mold by reducing the moisture in the air, which inhibits mold growth.

[/bc_card][bc_card title="Are dehumidifiers really worth it?"]

Dehumidifiers are worth it if you live in a humid environment or experience excess moisture in your home, as they can improve indoor air quality and prevent mold growth.

[/bc_card][bc_card title="How do I know if I need a dehumidifier?"]

You may need a dehumidifier if you notice condensation on windows, musty odors, or feel like the air is too humid. A hygrometer can also measure the humidity levels in your home to determine if a dehumidifier is necessary.

[/bc_card][/bc_accordion]

item.title: Air Purification Service in Evansville, IN & Louisville, KY
item.dc:creator: bluecorona_seo
item.content:encoded:
Based on EPA data, air pollution can occur indoors and outdoors and be 5 times as polluted. Hence, you might unknowingly expose your family to asthma, allergies, and lung disorders from pollutants thriving indoors. Founded in 1975, A+ Derr Heating & Cooling provides superior HVAC solutions.

 

If you live in the Kentuckiana area, book a free air purifier installation consultation today. Call A+ Derr at [site_info_phone_number]. 

 

 

Benefits of Getting an Air Purifier

When choosing an air filter, they offer several benefits. Air filters with HEPA filters can remove 99.7% of particles and pollutants in your home environment.

Other benefits include:

  • Improved health and rest: Sleep better, avoid sharing cold and flu germs, and reduce asthma symptoms by capturing dust mites, fungi, bacteria, dander, and pollen. These cause breathing difficulties, hay fever, coughing, sneezing, and watery eyes.
  • Remove harmful chemicals: Vehicle gasses (carbon monoxide, nitrogen dioxide) can raise Alzheimer’s disease and dementia risks. Household cleaners have toxic chemicals (chlorine, ammonia, and phthalates). These can increase tumor, cancer, and cardiovascular and neurological disorder risks.
  • Neutralize odors: Volatile organic compounds (VOCs) in some aerosol sprays can include benzene, gas, and formaldehyde, which can cause breathing problems, nausea, and cognitive problems.
  • Remove Radon: Some building materials, soil, rocks, and granite produce radon gas, but HEPA filters block the particles.
  • Eliminate harmful asbestos: Found in insulation pipes and roof materials, dust can cause lung disease and increase cancer risks. However, HEPA filters are excellent for capturing these types of particles. 

[cta_shortcode]

Air Purifier Installation

Air purifiers can lower pollution levels in your indoor air and improve your overall air quality. With filters lasting for two to three months, let us test your indoor air quality and find the right filter for a better indoor environment. Air purifiers suck in air, trap pollutants (dust, bacteria, pollen), and release clean air into your home.

 

Examples include: 

  • HEPA-filtered (capture pollutants 0.3 microns)
  • Ultraviolet rays (UVs kill germs and have washable filters)
  • Electrostatic precipitators (use volts to kill pathogens on a plate)
  • Ozone generators (absorb odors)
  • Activated carbon (traps odors, viruses, and bacteria)

 

Get a free quote on your air purifier installation today. Call A+ Derr at (833) 232-4328.

 

Why Choose A+ Derr?

Breathing quality air indoors can help keep you and your family safe. Rely on us for all your air quality solutions. Backed by our “Service Today or You Don’t Pay!” motto, we have over 45 years of experience and excellent reviews. Trust us for transparent pricing, flexible financing, and special online deals. 

 

Recycle fresh air in your Evansville, IN, or Louisville, KY, home by calling us at [site_info_phone_number].

 

Air Purifier FAQs

[bc_accordion][bc_card title=" Do air purifiers really work?"]

Yes, air purifiers use filters to catch and remove numerous irritants, pollutants, and airborne allergens. Filtering air improves overall air quality and reduces indoor air pollution. 

[/bc_card][bc_card title=" Do I need an air purifier?"]

Signs you might need an indoor air purifier include if you or your family suffer from allergies, respiratory illnesses, or asthma. An air quality test can confirm if you have poor indoor air.

[/bc_card][bc_card title=" Are air purifiers worth it?"]

Yes, because they remove pollutants and irritants and clean the air in your home, and those with UV lights can kill airborne pathogens. Breathing in fewer germs, bacteria, dirt, dander, pollen, and dust mites can improve your health.

[/bc_card][/bc_accordion]

item.title: Geothermal Replacement in Kentuckiana & Illinois
item.dc:creator: bluecorona_seo
item.content:encoded:
Thinking about switching to a geothermal heat pump? They can reduce heating costs, are environmentally friendly, and provide heat, cold air, and hot water. With quiet performance, they are similar to air source heat pumps, ideal for residential use, and keep homes toasty warm. Since 1975, A+ Derr Heating & Cooling has provided HVAC services in Evansville, Indiana, and Louisville. As a fourth-generation family-operated company and Lennox Premier Dealer, we offer free geothermal estimates on replacement quotes and service calls.

Learn more about geothermal benefits in Kentucky. Call A+ Derr at [site_info_phone_number].

 

 

Benefits of Replacing Your System

Similar to replacing a typical HVAC system, like a gas or electric furnace, replacing your traditional heat pump or older geothermal heat pump is standard for our experienced technicians. Our background-checked and licensed technicians are available for all your geothermal needs.

Benefits of replacing your old heat pump include:

  • Environmental friendliness: Geothermal heat pumps are tremendously reliable and use solar energy (instead of fossil fuel) from beneath the earth’s surface or bodies of water.

  • Return on Investment: The Department of Energy estimates that geothermal heat pumps can pay themselves off within five to 10 years of purchase. Expect to save up to 30% to 70% annually on heating costs ($400 to $1,500) as these systems outlast traditional heating equipment.

  • Longevity: Standard heat pumps last 10 to 15 years. However, geothermal heaters can function without failure as they are underground. Their life span is 25+ years for indoor components and 50+ years for ground loops.

  • Functionality: Geothermal heating systems operate quietly, are ideal for cold weather, and are investments that pay off over time.

Expert Installation

Geothermal heater installation varies. It can take about four days minimum to install, with two days for drilling and two days for installing the ground loops.

[cta_shortcode]

How Geothermal Heat Pumps Work

With underground temperatures stable at 50 to 60 degrees, pipes fill with conducting liquid underground (your yard or driveway) and then circulate through your home's heat pump for thermal energy indoors. The steps work in reverse to cool your Kentucky home and remove hot air outside.

After your geothermal installation, consider setting up routine maintenance to detect any complications before they exacerbate. Our technicians will keep your heater working correctly.

Signs You Need a Geothermal Repair/Replacement

While self-sufficient, on rare occasions, older geothermal heaters may need repair or replacement. Repairs are usually only necessary annually. However, for units over 20 years old, you might see signs like:

  • The above-ground pumps, compressors, and fans may need repair.
  • It has worn-out pumps, a loss of power or heat, or you hear rattling noises.
  • It has malfunctioning coils, corrosion, ductwork issues, or water pollution.

Request a geothermal repair in Kentuckiana today. Contact A+ Derr at [site_info_phone_number].

Why Choose A+ Derr?

Our specialists can help with your geothermal heater installation and ensure you find the best geothermal heat pump for your space and price range. While underground fitting varies based on your existing unit, we offer meticulous installation and will help with every detail, so you have comfortable temperatures year-round.

Schedule geothermal installation in Southern Indiana by calling A+ Derr at [site_info_phone_number].

FAQs

[bc_accordion] [bc_card title="How long does geothermal installation take?"] It can vary based on your existing heating system and area, as drilling might take two days, and installation accounts for an additional two days. [/bc_card] [bc_card title="Is geothermal right for me?"] Despite the upfront costs as an initial investment, geothermal systems can last 50+ years with your ROI after five to 10 years. They also outperform and outlast traditional heat pumps. [/bc_card] [/bc_accordion]

item.title: Geothermal Repair in Kentuckiana & Illinois
item.dc:creator: bluecorona_seo
item.content:encoded:
Geothermal heat pumps are reliable and generally require less maintenance than other heating/cooling systems. However, while you can expect your geothermal system to provide exceptional comfort and last longer than other systems, there is always the possibility that parts can malfunction.

Our geothermal experts will thoroughly inspect your system to diagnose the cause of the failure and will quickly and effectively resolve the problem. We’re committed to your comfort and ensuring your satisfaction with our services and guarantee we will always go the extra mile to deliver the superior results you deserve!

When your geothermal system malfunctions, schedule prompt repair in Kentuckiana or Illinois by calling A+ Derr at [site_info_phone_number].

Signs To Repair Your Geothermal System

It’s always advisable to pay close attention to your geothermal system. If you notice any of the following issues, we recommend scheduling a repair appointment:

  • Odd noises/smells: Water contamination, dirty air filters, mold/mildew growth, and mechanical failures can cause strange noises and smells.

  • Insufficient heating capacity: Electrical problems, antifreeze leaks, malfunctioning fans, or problems with the heat pump can cause inadequate heating.

  • Poor airflow: This can occur because of faulty fan motors, bad heat pumps, clogs, or electrical problems.

  • Pressure loss: Pressure loss can happen when the ground loop expands, reducing pressure within the system.

Expert Repair

Our geothermal heat pump repair specialists are highly trained experts with the advanced skills and state-of-the-art technologies necessary to service your geothermal system properly. Our team will promptly diagnose the cause of the malfunction and quickly perform the necessary repairs. Once the repairs are complete, we will thoroughly check your system to verify that the issue has been resolved.

We have the tools and expertise to repair your ground loop, heat pump, and distribution system effectively. We adhere to strict safety and quality standards and use only top-quality components and industry-approved repair solutions when servicing your system.

Schedule effective geothermal repairs in Kentucky or Illinois by reaching out to our professionals at [site_info_phone_number].

Why Choose A+ Derr?

Our family-owned and -operated company has proudly served clients in Kentuckiana and Illinois for four generations. Over the past 50 years, we have established our company as the region's leading provider of top-quality HVAC services. Rain or shine, frost or snow, our team is always ready to provide the service and solutions you deserve!

When you want superior service and exceptional quality results, reach out to the team at A+Derr to schedule geothermal repairs in Southern Indiana or Illinois online, or call us at [site_info_phone_number].

FAQs

[bc_accordion] [bc_card title="Can I repair my geothermal system myself?"] Geothermal systems are vast and require specialized skills and techniques to service appropriately. Because there is a serious risk of injury or causing extensive damage to your system, we strongly advise against DIY repairs. Indeed, any attempt at repairing the system without the proper tools and training will likely exacerbate the damage and increase the complexity and cost of the required repairs. [/bc_card] [bc_card title="What are the most common issues with geothermal systems?"] Geothermal systems are safe and reliable but susceptible to many of the same problems that can affect other HVAC systems and appliances. These include mineral buildup that can impede operation, malfunctioning fan motors, water contamination, dirty air filters, and blocked ductwork. [/bc_card] [/bc_accordion]

item.dc:creator: bluecorona_seo
item.content:encoded:

  • Heating installation and replacement

Systems We Serve

  • Furnaces

  • Geothermal

Check out our heating products.

Repairing Your Heating vs. Replacing Your Heating

Ultimately, the best way to tell if you need to repair your heating system or replace it is to have it professionally looked at, but some telltale signs that you may need to replace it are:

  • Your system is older than 15 years old
  • Some rooms in your home are too hot or cold

Boilers play a crucial role in maintaining a comfortable environment in your home or business. Regular maintenance and timely interventions can extend their life span. However, recognizing the signs of needed repairs can prevent more significant issues.

[bc_accordion][bc_card title="Is a broken furnace an emergency?"]

[/bc_card][bc_card title="Why is my boiler leaking?"]

4 Signs To Replace Your Boiler

Boilers are a durable and efficient system, but even with the best maintenance and care, you'll eventually require a replacement. Most boilers last for approximately 15 years before showing signs that they are on their last legs, including:

  • Frequent breakdowns: If you are constantly dealing with costly repairs and frustrating breakdowns, it may be more cost-efficient to get a more reliable and energy-efficient system.
  • Increased energy bills: If you notice your energy costs on the rise, it could be because your boiler is getting less and less efficient with age, costing you more money in operating costs.
  • Bad smells: If you smell rotten eggs, you may have a carbon monoxide leak, while other smells, like a metallic or burning odor, may need more investigation.
  • Poor performance: If you aren’t getting sufficient heat or are finding hot spots throughout your home, your boiler is likely struggling and can’t work at peak performance the way it once did.

item.title: Boiler Maintenance in IL, IN & KY
item.dc:creator: bluecorona
item.content:encoded:
At A+ Derr Heating & Cooling, we specialize in top-quality boiler maintenance services to ensure your system runs efficiently and reliably. Our commitment to your satisfaction is absolute, backed by a 100% satisfaction guarantee. We offer free estimates on replacement quotes and service calls, providing you with transparent and upfront information for all your boiler maintenance needs.

Ensure your boiler operates at its best with A+ Derr Heating & Cooling. Schedule boiler maintenance in Evansville or Louisville by calling [site_info_phone_number].

How Often Do Boilers Need Maintenance?

Boilers typically require annual maintenance to ensure optimal performance and longevity. This yearly checkup allows a professional technician to inspect, clean, and repair boiler system components, ensuring it runs efficiently and safely.

Regular maintenance helps prevent unexpected breakdowns and maximizes energy efficiency, which can lead to lower heating bills. It's also important to note that the frequency of maintenance might vary based on the boiler's age, model, and usage patterns, so consulting with a qualified HVAC professional for personalized advice is advisable.

[cta_shortcode]

Five Benefits of Regular Boiler Tune-Ups

Regular boiler tune-ups are essential for maintaining your system's efficiency and reliability. Here are five key benefits:

  • Improved efficiency: Tune-ups ensure your boiler operates at peak efficiency, reducing energy consumption and lowering utility bills.
  • Extended life span: Regular maintenance can significantly extend the life of your boiler, delaying the need for costly replacements.
  • Enhanced safety: Tune-ups help identify and fix potential safety hazards, like gas leaks or faulty electrical connections, ensuring your home's safety.
  • No unexpected breakdowns: Regular checks can catch and resolve minor issues before they escalate into major problems, preventing unexpected breakdowns.
  • Maintain warranty: Many manufacturers require regular maintenance as a condition of their warranty, so tune-ups help keep your coverage valid.

Book an appointment with A+ Derr Heating & Cooling for expert maintenance and peace of mind. Contact us at [site_info_phone_number] today.

What’s Included in a Boiler Maintenance Visit?

During a standard boiler maintenance visit, a technician conducts a thorough inspection and cleaning to ensure your boiler's safety and efficiency. This includes visually inspecting the boiler exterior, flue system, gas connections, and safety devices like pressure relief valves and high-limit switches and checking for damage, leaks, or corrosion.

They also inspect and clean the firebox and heat exchanger for soot buildup or damage. Our technicians will clean the burners, igniters, heat exchangers, the flue system, and the air filters. Performance checks include verifying gas pressure, measuring combustion efficiency, checking carbon monoxide emissions, and testing safety controls.

Additional services might include lubricating moving parts, performing minor repairs, and providing recommendations based on their findings.

Join Our Maintenance Plan To Save on Boiler Tune-Ups

Signing up for A+ Derr Heating & Cooling's maintenance plan is an investment in the longevity and efficiency of your HVAC system. Our plan includes two yearly HVAC tune-ups, ensuring your system is always running at its best. You'll enjoy Priority Service as a member, meaning you get precedence over nonmembers when scheduling service calls. Plus, you benefit from a minimum 15% discount on parts and labor for all service calls. Take advantage of this opportunity to save money and keep your home comfortable year-round.

Schedule boiler maintenance now and explore the benefits of our comprehensive maintenance plan. Contact us online or at [site_info_phone_number] to enjoy priority service and exclusive discounts in Evansville, IN, or Louisville, KY.

item.title: Whole-Home Generator Services in Evansville & Louisville
item.dc:creator: bluecorona
item.content:encoded:
It can be tough to deal with a blackout, even for a short time. What will happen the next time you lose power at your home? Count on A+ Derr Heating & Cooling to equip your home with a generator.

Our team installs top-quality, brand-name generator systems. We'll discuss your needs and help you choose a generator that fits your home's electrical needs. When we're done, you can rest assured that you'll be ready for the next outage.

Schedule whole-home generator services in Louisville or Evansville today. Call [site_info_phone_number] now to get started.

4 Benefits of Installing a Standby Generator

Power outages plague our area throughout the year due to our heavy rains and surprise winter storms. There are many benefits to installing a generator for your home. Just a few perks of these systems include:

  • Consistent power: When the power goes out, your lights, appliances, and devices will stay on.
  • Safety: With power always available to your home, you can keep the heat or AC running as needed.
  • Refrigeration: When the power goes out, your refrigerator and freezer will continue to run without issue.
  • Convenience: A generator will allow you to go on with life as if there’s no outage at all.

[cta_shortcode]

Trusted Generator Installation in IL, IN & KY

The entire team at A+ Derr works hard to deliver exceptional service to every client. When you need a whole-home generator installed or replaced, our team is on it! We work with Generac generators, which are the best in the industry.

You can count on us to explain your needs and answer any questions you have about generator services. We’ll ensure that your system is installed correctly and running right before we call the job complete.

Turn to a trusted generator installer for your generator needs. Call us now at [site_info_phone_number] to request services in IL, IN, or KY.

Why Choose Us?

Since 1975, A+ Derr has delivered exceptional home services in Illinois, Evansville, and Louisville. We're a fourth-generation family-owned business that treats every customer like one of our own. We provide financing, specials, upfront pricing, and expert service on every assignment.

Leave your need for generator services to a team of professionals. Call [site_info_phone_number] now to schedule an appointment in Louisville or Evansville.

FAQs

[bc_accordion][bc_card title="How long can I run a standby generator?"]

Major brand-name generator companies state that their generators can run continuously for up to 500 hours without a problem. If refilled with fuel as needed, you can keep a generator running for weeks if necessary.

[/bc_card][bc_card title="What size generator do I need for my entire house?"]

The size of your generator should be based on the size of your home and the wattage of your appliances. Generators range from 2,000 watts to 8,500 or even more. Our technicians can discuss your needs and provide a system that fits.

[/bc_card][bc_card title="Are whole-house generators really worth it for me?"]

Whole-house generators are generally considered worth it for everyone. But they are especially useful for people in areas prone to extended outages and those who rely on electricity for major appliances and home systems like furnaces or water heaters.

[/bc_card][/bc_accordion]

Winners will be randomly chosen and revealed on the first day of the subsequent month. The average value of giveaway items is $200.
